definition: to take in/to absorb/to admit/to accept
to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing

sentences.english: The clock tower affair has set the alarm bells ringing.
sentences.chinese: 今次天星鐘樓事件，爲港府吸納民意的機制敲響警鐘。

sentences.english: By comparing the two sides can complement each other I have found that Chinese and Western absorb purposes.
sentences.chinese: 經由過程比力我發明中西單方皆可互補，吸納之用。

sentences.english: This programme has continued to expand with an additional nine farms accredited.
sentences.chinese: 該計劃續有進展，現已吸納九家新農場。

sentences.english: Public hospitals cannot recruit all medical students.
sentences.chinese: 公立醫院無法吸納所有醫科生。

sentences.english: Each system adapted elements of what those fleeing Lyra brought with them.
sentences.chinese: 每個系統吸納了那些逃離天琴星的人所帶來的要素。

sentences.english: He has an even chance of being accepted by the program.
sentences.chinese: 他有百分之五十的機會被吸納進這個項目。

sentences.english: The meritocratic corpocracy absorbs rival power bases.
sentences.chinese: 這個精英體制吸納了競爭力。

sentences.english: Hong Kong's booming pleasure boat sector will probably absorb many of the former fishermen.
sentences.chinese: 而香港新興的遊船業也可能借機吸納很多前漁民就業。

sentences.english: They pocket four-fifths of hijras' earnings.
sentences.chinese: 他們吸納了海吉拉斯五分之四的收入。

sentences.english: We will encourage the development of consumer services that can create more jobs and are urgently needed in the market.
sentences.chinese: 發展就業吸納能力強和市場需求大的生活性服務業。

sentences.english: The way that BeautifulPeople.com accepts new members is simple.
sentences.chinese: 網站吸納新成員的方法很簡單。

sentences.english: What marks Mr Madoff's case out, however, is the calibre of investor he suckered .
sentences.chinese: 麥道夫案的顯著之處在於他吸納的高品質投資者。

sentences.english: The experience of international home proves, what can induct obtain employment most is medium and small businesses.
sentences.chinese: 國際國內的經驗證明，最能夠吸納就業的是中小企業。

sentences.english: The market absorbed all the computers we could build.
sentences.chinese: 市場吸納了我們所能生產的全部電腦。

sentences.english: But disappointed graduates are learning that it can no longer absorb an army of trained twenty-two-year-olds, either.
sentences.chinese: 但失望的大學畢業生卻得知，它不再能吸納大量，也。

sentences.english: Chi Zijian 's novel text closely relates the history, and has taken in the new method.
sentences.chinese: 遲子建的小說文本鍾情於歷史，並吸納了新的方法。

definition: to expand/to enlarge/to broaden one's scope
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
one step further/to move forward a step/further onwards
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
great family/rich family/large landlord/conspicuous spender or consumer
